article: How to Start a Home Internet Business
intro: Starting a home internet business can be an exciting and low-cost way to make extra money or start a new career. However, it can also be difficult to make your business a success. To increase your chances of success, create a business plan for your home-based business. Then, complete any necessary paperwork and set up your website. Finally, market your products or services to potential customers.

steps.title: Write your .
steps.subtitle: A  will help you stay on track to reach your goals, so even a small business needs a plan. Your business plan includes everything about your business, such as the following:
sub-points: : Describe your business and its structure, including the products or services you’ll offer. Additionally, briefly discuss the market for your business.
: Describe the market you are entering, including your major competitors, your target market, and the needs of your target market.
: Explain how you plan to enter your market, how you will communicate with customers, and how you will distribute your product or service.
: Explain your day-to-day operations, including steps involved in the production of your product or service.
: Outline how you will finance your business, what your expected costs are, and how much estimated revenue you expect to make.

steps.title: Register your trademarks and other proprietary information.
steps.subtitle: Although you'll need to pay required fees, your ideas can help you make more money in the long-run. Additionally, they can give you an edge against your competitors, so make sure you protect them with a trademark or patent. You can register a trademark or patent through the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.
sub-points: You can find the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office here:
It's best to work with a lawyer to protect your intellectual property.

steps.title: Make sure your website is polished and user-friendly.
steps.subtitle: As you build your website, keep in mind that it serves two main purposes: to advertise your product or service and to facilitate sales. It should do both as simply and as clearly as possible. Here are the best practices for creating a professional site:
sub-points: The site is simple and looks professional.
The site loads quickly and is viewable on all browsers and devices.
The site is easy to navigate in order to find necessary information and purchase goods or services.
The site features attractive photography, particularly if you are selling tangible objects that can be photographed.
The site provides contact information, such as your phone number.
